user_review: Cannot login even if i have created an account with Wikipedia. I think the app must be awesome. Please fix this issue asap.
pull_request: Fix bugs associated with new signup feature Fix #48 issue_#48: Allow account creation from within the app Non-Wikimedians who witness an important event may become aware of the app and install it in a hurry to upload their pictures. But anonymous upload is not allowed by Commons ("You must be logged in to upload file"). In such case, better make whatever we can to make account registration as fast and straightforward as possible. Embedding that within the app would be the best. For reference, the web site registration form looks like this:
author: misaochan

user_review: Cannot login even if i have created an account with Wikipedia. I think the app must be awesome. Please fix this issue asap.
pull_request: Account creation from within app (web view) Fixes #48 . This works appropriately (redirects user to login screen) after creation of the first account. If the user tries to create a 2nd account, the redirection doesn't work (the user isn't redirected, although they can manually return by back button). Reinstalling the app resolves this. Given that a user is expected to only create an account once, I think this is a minor bug so we can release this for the time being while I try to figure out the reason. issue_#48: Allow account creation from within the app Non-Wikimedians who witness an important event may become aware of the app and install it in a hurry to upload their pictures. But anonymous upload is not allowed by Commons ("You must be logged in to upload file"). In such case, better make whatever we can to make account registration as fast and straightforward as possible. Embedding that within the app would be the best. For reference, the web site registration form looks like this:

user_review: It's cool how it lets you contribute to Wikipedia via creative Commons licensed photos that you take this has been the easiest way for me to add to Wikipedia
pull_request: Switch Nearby to Wikidata Query Fixes #289 partially - not a full migration but a first step. Wikidata-based results seem to be less accurate - it sometimes suggests articles with images on Wikipedia pages (but without an image on Wikidata). I think further filtering is necessary. This may fix #485 too. (It works for me, but please test.) issue_#289: Switch to Wikidata in addition instead of wiki-needs-pictures I started to wonder whether we should use Wikidata instead of wiki-needs-pictures. Advantages of Wikidata: Advantages of wiki-needs-pictures: All of the API requests we need (and more) can be found in the new WikiShootMe: https://tools.wmflabs.org/wikishootme/ When this WDFIST issue is fixed, I think we should also link to WDFIST like WikiShootMe does. For Wikidata items that do not have an image, it proposes some found on the Wikipedia articles linked to this item. Extremely useful before deciding whether walking that 2 kilometers detour is really worth it. issue_#485: Pre-release Nearby does not detect location The pre-release version of Nearby (current master branch) loads the CSV, but does not detect your location when used in a freshly-installed app. Tested on an API 24 real device (Samsung Galaxy S7). The released version works fine (tested on the same night). Might have something to do with location permissions not being asked? Not sure, will have to test further. @maskaravivek , what do you think could have broken it?

user_review: I need to use another name instead of my username.
pull_request: Adding username to Drawer This addresses issue #719. Please let me know if I am doing something horribly wrong. issue_#719: There's no way to tell what account I'm logged in with After downloading the app I tried logging in with my normal account ("Jon Harald Søby"), but presumably because of the 2FA problems, I wasn't able to. So I logged in with an alternate account I have ("Jhsoby"), which worked – but once I was logged in, there was no way of telling which user account I was actually logged in with. I would suggest solving this by appending the user's username to the "Logout" button (which would then need to be able to wrap to two or more lines as needed to accomodate long usernames), but there are probably other and/or better ways to solve it too.

pull_request: Prevent duplicates Implement #77 issue_#77: Prevent uploading duplicate This was commented by Revent in my grant proposal announcement at https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Commons:Village_pump#IEG_proposal:_Improve_Upload_to_Commons_Android_app: @misaochan: I have no idea if it has even been addressed, but a minor issue in the past with the mobile apps was editors (presumably unintentionally) uploading 5, 6, or more duplicates of the same image within a couple of minutes, under a numbered series of filenames. A check, of some type, of if the person has previously uploaded the exact same image would be a good thing. (I can't point at an example offhand, since they get speedied quickly). Reventtalk 22:13, 5 March 2016 (UTC) Do you think this could be fixable @nicolas-raoul ?

user_review: Many options lacking compared to the website.
pull_request: Fixes#1238 Skip feature added in login [Description] Fixes #1238The following changes are made to implement skip login feature:- 1. Added skip button in login. 2. Implemented onClick in skip button which redirects to NearbyImagesActivity 3. Added new sharedPreference parameter (login_skipped) - True if login is skipped else false. 4. Made navigation drawer dynamic according to login_skipped parameter (checked via sharedprefs) issue_#1238: Remove hurdle of creating an account Google Play statistics suggests that a lot of people uninstall the app just after installing it. I suspect that the biggest blocker is the login screen. Most people probably give up at that step. Proposed solution: Allow people to browse Commons, and even upload pictures, without the hurdle of choosing a username and password. The app could show: Log in with existing account / Create an account / Continue without an account "Continue without an account" would actually create a random name and password, and store them in the app's local database. Uninstalling the app would mean the account is lost forever. Or we could have a small dialog that shows the username/password that have been created. I am not sure whether all of this is possible (for instance account creation might require solving a captcha which might be difficult to make the user solve), but it might be worth considering.
author: ujjwalagrawal17

user_review: I am a regular user of commons but I faced several problem. it doesn't allow to upload multiple photos, can't read the file name, always ask for it. and after uploading when I browse the photos from desktop I saw an message that it doesn't belong any description but I already add the description.
pull_request: Fix crash when uploading multiple photos. nan
author: dbrant

user_review: I downloaded this app thinking it would give me a nice way to browse wiki Commons, but unfortunately it's only for uploading your own images. That's a nice feature, but I feel that it would be a Much better app if it had a clean, simple built in way of searching, browsing, and viewing, (and downloading/sharing) all of the photos uploaded to wiki Commons. That would make this app easily worth 5 stars!
pull_request: Add feature to Browse commons via app [Description] Improvements in category images activity (Changed it to explore activity) added search activity with 2 fragments (one for searching images, other for categories) Added recent Search history and delete recent search hostory feature Added a category details page (includes media, subcategories, parent categories inside that category) issue_#1221: Allow users to browse Commons from app [Summary:] My suggestion is to enable the user to access the Mobile version of Wikimedia Commons Website within their app. This would give an integrated feel to the user. I noticed that this has been the main concern with people in playstore reviews. Sorry if this issue has already been discussed [Steps to reproduce:] Adding a new activity which would display the mobile version of Wikimedia Commons app using a webView.
author: ujjwalagrawal17

user_review: Upload only. No way to browse Commons.
